title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: The story takes place during three years of the Great Depression in the fictional Maycomb, Alabama.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The novel follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet, the dynamic protagonist of the book.

author: George Orwell
description: The story takes place in an imagined future, the year 1984, when much of the world has fallen victim to perpetual war, omnipresent government surveillance, historical negationism, and propaganda.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The novel details two days in the life of Holden Caulfield after he has been expelled from prep school.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The novel tells the story of the Buendía family, chronicling their lives over the course of seven generations.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: The novel anticipates developments in reproductive technology, sleep-learning, psychological manipulation, and classical conditioning that combine to profoundly change society.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The novel chronicles an era that Fitzgerald himself dubbed the 'Jazz Age'.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: The novel is set in the Yorkshire moors, and the story follows the life of Heathcliff, a mysterious orphan, and his doomed love for Catherine Earnshaw.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: The story follows Sethe, a former slave, and her daughter Denver, who live in a house haunted by the ghost of Sethe's eldest daughter.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: The novel follows the experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester, the brooding master of Thornfield Hall.
